title: 111_hr1669
content: The curr_chunk is a section titled "SHORT TITLE; DEFINITIONS." The Act is titled the "Federal Municipal Bond Marketing Support and Securitization Act of 2009." Definitions for terms like "Board," "guarantee," and "municipal security" are provided in the Act. The term "Secretary" in the Federal Municipal Bond Marketing Support and Securitization Act of 2009 refers to the Secretary of the Treasury. Upon the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Treasury and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System shall consult extensively to find solutions for the financial crisis effects on municipal securities markets and cooperate in authorized activities to alleviate such effects. Purchase, sale, guarantee, and securitization of municipal securities by the Secretary and Federal Financing Bank are authorized. The Secretary of the Treasury will establish a program to purchase municipal securities, issue securities backed by these securities, and provide credit enhancement or guarantees. The Federal Financing Bank may make commitments to purchase and sell municipal securities and guarantee repayment of principal and interest on approved plans. The Secretary has authority over the method, source, timing, terms, and conditions of municipal securities issued for purchase under this section, ensuring orderly marketing and appropriate financing planning. The Secretary has authority over the method, source, timing, terms, and conditions of municipal securities issued for purchase under this section, ensuring orderly marketing and appropriate financing planning. Municipal securities sold by the Secretary or the Federal Financing Bank may be insured for payment of principal or interest and shall not be treated as such for any other purpose. The Secretary has authority over municipal securities issued for purchase, ensuring orderly marketing and appropriate financing planning. Municipal securities sold by the Secretary or the Federal Financing Bank may be insured for payment but should not be considered as having the full faith and credit of the United States. The Federal Reserve Board may establish a credit facility to provide financial resources for the purchase of municipal securities. Additionally, the Board can provide funds to the Secretary or the Federal Financing Bank for carrying out their authority under section 3. SEC. 5. BUDGET AUTHORITY. The Secretary or the Federal Financing Bank can only purchase or guarantee municipal securities if authorized in advance by appropriation Acts.
